project.teaser: The ever-growing resource needs of modern-day applications regarding guaranteed low latency and the massive data transfer rate are constantly pushing the boundaries of technologies and requiring a paradigm shift. To cater for these escalating resource needs, modern IT...
project.objective: The ever-growing resource needs of modern-day applications regarding guaranteed low latency and the massive data transfer rate are constantly pushing the boundaries of technologies and requiring a paradigm shift. To cater for these escalating resource needs, modern IT computing platforms have evolved beyond the more traditional central cloud/DC with bleeding-edge processing powers and high-capacity networking infrastructure to extend their coverage all the way to the network edge, which may also include the far-edge nowadays. This creates a new paradigm called cloud edge computing continuum (CECC), whereby the services span from core cloud to edge and far edge. To efficiently manage and continuously optimize resources through this new model using the CECC approach, we propose an Agile and Cognitive Cloud-edge Continuum (AC3) management framework. This framework will play a critical role in providing scalability, agility, effectiveness, and dynamicity in service delivery over the CECC infrastructure. AC3 will offer a common and secure federated platform that manages data source, CECC resources, and application behaviour in a unified and harmonized manner to ensure the desired SLA and save energy consumption. Moreover, the AC3 platform can adapt to a different context and events happening in the network, such as lack of resources, data deluge, or mobility of data source, by managing (i.e., deploying or migrating) micro-services across CECC infrastructures. AC3 will leverage AI, ML, and semantic and context awareness algorithms to provide an efficient life cycle management system of services, data sources, and CECC resources for ensuring low response time and high data rate while saving energy consumption.
project.title: Agile and Cognitive Cloud edge Continuum management
project.keywords: Cloud-Edge Computing Continuum, Data management, IoT, AI, ML, XAI, Cloud-native applications, Green management

article.title: New platform enables the transition from data centres to the edge

result.title: WebSite
result.description: Launch of public project website and initiation of targeted media channels

result.title: Report on technological tools for CECC
result.description: Report on the technological enablers that are envisioned to implement the CECCM. The document surveys the existing tools and technological enablers, such as Kubernetes, Openshift, LFEdge, Kubedge, and provides classification whether adapted to micro-service, cloud, edge, and far edge.

result.title: Report on the resource management procedures over CECC – Initial
result.description: Initial report on mechanisms that enable green-oriented zero touch management of CECC resources, covering activities related to resource discovery and monitoring, AI/ML methods for resource management, LCM decisions, and networking programmability.

result.title: Data Management Plan - Intermediate
result.description: Second Version of the Data Management Plan including the generated datasets from test and trials.

result.title: Technology Infrastructure for energy aware: supporting the use of green energy

details.journalTitle: El papel de las universidades en los objetivos de desarrollo sostenible: innovación docente y experiencias significativas // The Role of Universities in Sustainable Development Goals: Educational Innovation and Meaningful Experiences

result.title: 1st Release of the CECC framework and CECCM
result.description: Initial report on the CECC framework and CECCM covering the federated and open API, functional blocks of the CECCM.

result.title: Business analysis of CECC and use case requirements
result.description: Report analysing the technico-economic aspects of the CECC resource federation and identifying the interactions between the stakeholders. Moreover, exploring novel incentive methods to motivate end-users to participate in the CECC infrastructure. Finally, providing detailed requirements of the AC3 use-cases.

result.title: Dissemination Communication and Exploitation (D-C-E) plans
result.description: Initial version D-C-E plans and mapping of stakeholders.

result.title: Report on data management for applications in CECC – Initial
result.description: Initial report on the data management mechanisms adopted in AC3 allowing application developers to handle data life cycle.

result.title: Report on the application LCM in the CEC – Initial
result.description: Initial report on mechanisms to ease application LCM in the CEC, including solutions related to SLA and intent models, application profile models, and stateful service migration

result.title: Security and trust management for CECC - Initial
result.description: Initial report detailing the security and trust management mechanisms and tools and enablers.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - AC3 (Agile and Cognitive Cloud edge Continuum management)
result.teaser: The key objectives of the AC3 project are to design, develop, and evaluate a Cloud Edge Continuum Computing Manager (CECCM) featuring AI/ML and XAI to: (1) Handle Life Cycle Management (LCM) of new application models (micro-service-based) by redefining SLA, predicting...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
